snippet: The number of new claims for unemployment benefits fell more than expected last week, but the trade deficit widened by 12 percent in December.
abstract: Labor Department reports that initial claims for weekly unemployment benefits declined by more-than-expected 20,000 to seasonally adjusted 331,000; Commerce Department reports that the trade deficit widened by 12 percent in December to $38.7 billion, in part because of the largest decline in exports since October 2012
lead_paragraph: The number of new claims for unemployment benefits fell more than expected last week, but the trade deficit widened by 12 percent in December.

headline.main: Solid Jobs Data Is Tempered by Report on Weak Exports
headline.print_headline: Solid Jobs Data Is Tempered by Report on Weak Exports
